div3.p: will be paid for the apprehension and delivery to me, at Battery No. 3, of each of the following deserters:
J. M. Melton, dark eyes, hair, and complexion: 6 feet 1 inch high, age 18 years.
O. Melton, dark eyes, black hair, and dark complexion; 5 feet 6 inches high, age 27 years.
P. Y. Million, dark eyes, hair, and complexion; 6 feet 1 inch high, age 30 years.

W. L. Lucas, light eyes and hair, and fair complexion; 5 feet 8½ inches high.
Were a gray uniform on leaving camp.
Jno. Ford, light gray eyes, sandy hair, ruddy complexion, reddish beard, 5 feet 9 inches high.
The above reside in and around Hungary, Hanover county.
J. E. Cosby, dark eyes, hair, and complexion; 5 feet 11 inches high — is supposed to be lurking in and around the city of Richmond.

div3.head: Thirty dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Deserted on the 15th day of April. 1862, at or near Richmond Private Spotswood F. Garton, a member of Company B, 19th regiment Virginia volunteers.
Said Gattoni is thought to be lurking about ivy Depot, Albemarle county, Va.--The above reward will be paid for the said Garton when delivered to me, at the camp of the 19th regiment Virginia volunteers, near Richmond Garton is about 21 years old; light hair; light blue eyes, thick set; five feet nine or ten inches high; quick spoken, and is a resident of Albemarle county, Va.
div3.closer:
R. Wesp Wirl, Com'g Co. B,
General Longstreet's Division,
je 4--6t* 34 Brigade.

div3.head: $30 reward.
div3.p:
--Deserted from my company, at Camp Winder, private John Kaylor, a substitute.
Said Kaylor is about 5 feet 8 inches high, dark complexion, light hair, and hazel eyes, is about 21 years old, was mustered in on the 23; ult, left that night, and has not been seen since.
I will pay the above reward for the apprehension and delivery of said Kaylor to the Provost Marshal.
div3.closer:
Joseph Jones, Captain
je 4--6t* Co. 20th Va., Reg't.

div3.head: Maryland Partisan Corps.
div3.p: --The undersigned, late Captain of company C. 1st Maryland regiment, is organizing a Cavalry Company, to be attached to the Partisan Corps of Col. W. H. Jenifer.
Having all the men of my former command, I require but few more to fill up my complement.

Pay, rations, and bounty, same as in he regular service, and in addition thereto, the value of all captures from the enemy will be distributed among the men. Horses furnished if required. --Parties desirous of enlisting will apply at Major Weston's counting-room, No. 15 Pearl street.
div3.closer:
my 3t — 10t*
R. Bt. O. Smith.

div3.p:
I Am Authorized by the Governor of Virginia under the act of May 15th, 1862. to raise a Regiment of Cavalry, to serve under Major General Floyd.
Men wishing to enlist, and officers deterring to raise Companies, or assist in the organization, can get authority to do so by seeing or addressing me by letter at this place.
My office for the present will be at my residence, on South side of Franklin street, next door to second.
div3.closer:
J. E. Johnson.
my 30--2w* Colonel of Cavalry.

div3.head:
Hdq'rs Md. Partisan Corps,
Richmond, may 18, 1862.
div3.p: the undersigned having received authority to organize a
Partisan Corps of Marylanders, invites all young men from that State to join his corps, which will be composed of cavalry, artillery and infantry.

Horses will be furnished to the cavalry, if requested.
Pay, rations and bounty the same as in regular service, and the value of all captures divided in the corps.
Marylanders enlisted for 12 months, including those who have re-enlisted, can obtain transfers to this corps.
Recruiting office at Maj. J. A. Weston's Counting Room, No. 15 Pearl street.
div3.closer:
W. H. Jenifer,
my 29--ts Colonel P. A. C. S.

div3.head: Attention, Martin's Battery!
div3.p: --All members of this command who are absent without leave, will report at once at "Camp Lee," or they will be reported to the Provost Guard and arrested as deserters.
Persons wishing to join the company will apply to Serg't Pulliam, at the Recruiting office, corner of Bank and 12th streets.
div3.closer:
S. Taylor Martin, Captain.
ap 31--ts

div3.head: Attention, Light Artillery.
div3.p:
--I am authorized by the Governor to receive Substitutes in my company of Light Artillery, and to muster them in as they come.
Those, therefore, who desire to procure substitutes, or who wish to become substitutes, should call at once at my headquarters, Johnson &Guigon's office, under the Whig Building.
div3.closer:
A. B. Guigon,
mh 28--G Captain Light Artillery.
